meta.description: Per-team CFP road scenarios since the last CFP ranking release.

teams.name: Texas Tech

best_case.headline: #1 seed, prime path to title
best_case.narrative: Texas Tech dominates the Big 12 Championship, wins by 30+, and benefits from losses or narrow wins by other top-4 teams. The committee rewards a red-hot finish and elevates TTU to the #1 or #2 seed with a favorable semifinal matchup.

worst_case.headline: Chaos pushes TTU down the seed line
worst_case.narrative: Even with a solid win, other contenders log blowout victories in high-visibility games, and the committee leans heavily on brand + strength of schedule. TTU drops a spot or two, drawing a tougher semifinal opponent.

likely_case.headline: Lock in a mid-top-4 seed
likely_case.narrative: TTU wins the Big 12 by a respectable margin, holds serve in the eye test, and secures a #2–#4 seed. The playoff path runs through a balanced semifinal, followed by a title shot against another elite defense/offense combo.

remaining_games.name: CFP Semifinal
remaining_games.note: Matchup will depend on final CFP seeding.

notes: Explosive offense and opportunistic defense are the key talking points.
Committee will weigh margin of victory and strength of schedule heavily versus SEC/Big Ten champions.

teams.name: Georgia

best_case.headline: Stay in the top 4 despite SEC title loss
best_case.narrative: Georgia’s body of work and prior dominance keep them firmly in the playoff despite a close SEC Championship loss. Other contenders either lose or win less impressively, preserving Georgia’s top-4 status.

worst_case.headline: Fall out of the top 4
worst_case.narrative: Multiple contenders behind Georgia post statement wins, and the committee opts to prioritize conference champions, pushing a non-SEC-champion Georgia to #5 or lower.

likely_case.headline: Edge into #3–#4 on resume strength
likely_case.narrative: A strong season plus a narrow SEC title game loss keeps Georgia in the 3–4 range, facing a higher-seeded champion in the semifinal.

notes: Committee will emphasize the SEC schedule strength and margin in the title game.
Head-to-head results and common opponents will matter if more than one 1-loss team is in contention.
